#fishbonebeanie @srd_handmades 2019 materials notes ❖ any dk or light worsted weight yarn in two contrasting ❖ this pattern is sized for adult s/m increase needle size to colours adjust gauge for larger size or added additional stitches ❖ us size 7 | 4 5 mm 16 circular knitting needles between charts ❖ us size 7 | 4 5 mm dpns for decrease if desired or use magic ❖ charts are worked right to left from the bottom up loop method ❖ i recommend carrying your floats every 5 8 stitches ❖ 5 stitch markers ❖ gauge is crucial but difficult to balance if your gauge is ❖ 1 tapestry needle too tight your work will pucker and will not stretch even ❖ scissors when blocked if your gauge is too loose your stitches will look very sloppy for best results ensure you do not bunch gauge your stitches while knitting allow natural spacing between each stitch ❖ 21 stitches x 26 row in 4 blocked ❖ the brim will tend to curl on you as the hat increases in length this can be reduced by blocking your finished hat abbreviations ❖ not all yarns in the same weight class are the same gauge you may need to change needle sizes to achieve the desired ❖ co cast on sizing ❖ k knit ❖ k2tog knit 2 stitches together ❖ dpn double pointed needles ❖ bor beginning of round ❖ sm stitch marker ❖ mc main colour ❖ cc contrast colour #fishbonebeanie @srd_handmades 2019 pattern using german twisted cast on method co 96 stitches in mc and join decrease change to dpn or magic loop when necessary to knit in the round row 1 k6 k2tog repeat to end of round place bor sm row 2 k row 3 k5 k2tog repeat to end of round row 1 4 knit row 4 k row 5 k4 k2tog repeat to end of round row 5 k4 sm using cc k per chart 1 sm k8 sm using cc k per row 6 k chart 2 sm k to end of round row 7 k3 k2tog repeat to end of round row 8 k row 6 31 k4 k per chart 1 k8 k per chart 2 k to end of round row 9 k2 k2tog repeat to end of round row 10 k continue knitting in mc for 4 inches for a more fitted style reduce row 11 k1 k2tog repeat
